column2: Your blood is replaced with cleansing Pure Liquid.
You bleed salt and slowly suck up nearby liquids, and take a bit less damage.
A few random items and potions appear for you!
Most nearby enemy corpses are converted into gold.
You melt nearby ice and other cold materials, and are immune to being frozen.
The stats of the wand in your hand are improved slightly.
Hearts that increase your maximum HP also heal you.
You gain a bonus perk in the Holy Mountain after killing enough enemies on a floor.
You gain an artefact that allows you to pacify the elements.
Your chance to find a healthy heart or a rare chest is greatly increased.
You release a myriad of ice-cold projectiles upon taking damage.
You gain a random immunity that may change when you are too confused.
Your wands charge mana faster depending on how many one-off perks you have.
You start your next run with +50 health and an extra perk, but you die instantly when under 20% health.
Creatures hit by your projectiles may rarely turn into a harmless sheep.
You feel a certain kinship with the robots of the world.
You gain a chance to block major damage.
Enemies hitting you at close range get electrically shocked, and you become immune to melee damage.
You gain 5 minutes of unlimited wand tinkering, and a random perk afterwards.
You leave a trail of helpful orbs that boost you in places you've already been.
Heals in future Holy Mountains only give you what you need, and can be taken bit by bit.
You gain brief invincibility upon entering an area for the first time.
An unprofessional spirit comes to your aid, and your aim is no longer disturbed whilst inebriated.
Standing still allows you to sense some secrets hidden throughout the world.
Standing still allows you to sense more secrets hidden throughout the world.
You take 75% less damage from projectiles, but double damage from everything else.
Any enemies below 10% health will instantly die.
You gain a bonus perk in future Holy Mountains, but you become terribly cursed...
You gain three orbitals that reflect enemy damage.
You feel an uncontainable rage inside you!
You feel tougher! You take 20% less damage.
You feel greedy! Gold nuggets give double payout.
You feel energized! You take 20% more damage.
You feel joyful! You take 33% less damage.
You have spurned your own sight.
You have spurned your enemies' sight.
You can edit your wands anywhere, for a time.
This area feels familiar... Your movement speed is boosted!
You feel cleansed. You take less damage when at higher health.
You feel extremely confused. Your head spins...
You protect nearby creatures, but your health is draining!
Your mind feels clear and fresh.\nYour immunity is locked... for now.
Your stomach turns... You move slower.
Healed and increased maximum health to $0
You feel the hum of malicious technology inside.
It pulses with an electrifying warmth. You feel as if it has a will to protect you.
An ominous red light emits from the craters.
Can be thrown to summon a protective steel vault
Transmute drops of cleansing liquid from nothing
Transmute drops of disgusting sludge from nothing
Creates a nice cup of coffee for you!
A projectile will rot and age nearby materials
A projectile will transmute nearby fire into water
A stationary blue orb that casts another spell after some time
A weak but enchanting sparkling projectile?
Transmutes everything in a short radius into ice, including walls, creatures... and you
Reduces the time between spellcasts and restores a bit of mana
Adds both healing and damage to a projectile, and allows it to hit the caster
Greatly decreases a projectile's chance to crit, but increases its damage
An expanding circle of satisfying mist
An expanding circle of violent mist
An expanding circle of acid or lava that will harm the environment but not the caster
A reliable upward shield that protects you from bullets
A reliable upward? shield that protects you from bullets
A magical bolt that jumps you a short distance forward, though it may make the user queasy...
Adds a small amount of many damage types to a projectile
Applies a lightweight version of Heat Wave to your wand
Applies a lightweight version of Freeze Field to your wand
Applies a lightweight version of Dissolve Powders to your wand
Applies a lightweight version of Attract Gold to your wand
Applies a lightweight version of Electricity to your wand
Applies a lightweight version of No More Knockback to your wand
Applies a lightweight version of Midas Meat to your wand
Switches any toggle Requirement spells between the red and blue state
Switches any toggle Requirement spells between the green and yellow state
Disables all toggle requirement spells until another toggler is cast
Skips the next spell if the toggler's value is not set to blue
Skips the next spell if the toggler's value is not set to red
Skips the next spell if the toggler's value is not set to green
Skips the next spell if the toggler's value is not set to yellow
An uncoordinated shot of elemental bubbles
Makes four Ominous Orbs rotate around a projectile
Your wand constantly emits a stream of blood
A strange bolt that dislikes walls and purity
A dense ball made of pure gold
Creates a harmless orb that boosts you after a short time
A damaging beam will stretch between you and a projectile
An ethereal magical arrow that stings
An ethereal magical arrow that casts another spell upon enemy collision
An ethereal magical arrow that casts another spell after a timer runs out
A projectile has no initial velocity, and is not affected by gravity
A colorful bouncing orb filled with a mysterious fluid
A burst of projectiles that silence
A one-way portal from a sinister place
Applies an aura to an enemy that drains its health to protect nearby creatures
A shimmering, weightless, and bouncy projectile
Toss a volatile explosive barrel at your enemies!
Generate an elemental stone in exchange for 20% of your max HP (must have 200 or more)
Any powders in a projectile's range will evaporate into an ominous poison gas
A holy bullet that applies a weakness to hit entities. Careful, it may backfire!

The preservation of technology is an important art, that relatively few seem to practice.
We mortals are fallible things, and memories go forgotten over time more often than not.
Therefore, I shall do my part in the preservation of technology old and new. But where to begin...?
Ah. Our Gods, and their gifts to us... some have been lost over time. Why or how or when, it is all unknown.
Perhaps these gifts, and their associated magicks, can be rediscovered somehow.
Tributes to the gods, in the form of feats to accomplish... Yes, I am certain this will work.
Dear reader, stay with me a moment longer. These gifts may be unearthed yet.
- Robin, the scholar

All scholars have work that they abandon.
Many materials are merely lost to time due to lack of interest.
That strange orange liquid, intoxicating to the touch... Where did it come from?
Made from pain and confusion and toxic waste, it seems to be full of potential.
It can convert diamond to gold, or snow to that which is pure.
It seems even whiskey and vomit have a purpose with this remarkable liquid.
Even the Gods' Brickwork and our Guns' bullets are overtaken by such a material.
But as with all things which seem to have potential...
Fire consumes it all the same.
I suppose all of us have our weaknesses.
- Robin, the scholar

Certain magical liquids can take over one's body and make them do horrible things they otherwise would not.
Many have been killed by those they trust due to Berserkium's malicious magic.
Worm blood is often ingested intentionally to help with the sight of its bearer.
Combined with sand, one can make a delightful delicacy.
Berserkium can also be combined with corpses to make a beverage straight from Hell itself.
And, of course, fungus can cause strange effects, especially when combined with polymorphine...
- Robin, the scholar

I've found it! The Gods have answered my prayers, and they've told me what I must do...
However, I lack the power to do so myself, and their hints are undecipherable to me. Ahem...
'Find yourself immune to the wizards that render their foes helpless.'
'Accept 3 Gifts from the Gods that provide no permanent benefit.'
'Live on the bleeding edge of death, and defeat foes while doing so.'
'Venture into the most ominous cave in this Land, and seek True Knowledge within.'
'Find and use one of the lost Experimental Wands.'
And, finally... 'Travel to the center of the lost cube of Water.'
I couldn't know what these hints mean. But, perhaps...
Someone far in the future will discover my notes, and unlock this potential themselves.
- Robin, the scholar

And, lo! The spell is cast, history prewritten rewritten. 
These damned spiders with the thousands of teeth...  their hunger insatiable, unless...?
I pacified them for my own survival, using a spell taught to me long ago.
However, such a force cannot be created or destroyed... only moved, redeveloped.
I have sealed their willpower in this very book. Such a power could be devastating or divine.
I leave that fate up to the Gods, or to you, curious reader...?
Perhaps the Gods would enjoy this tribute of willpower as a gift...?
- Robin, the scholar

I had been storing items in my treasure chest... Gold, potions, food...
I turned away, and heard a nasty chomp noise from behind me...
I swear I saw... teeth. And, when I opened the chest again... all the food was gone.
Is there something living in my storage? Or is it the chest itself...?
- Robin, the scholar

Oh, what a cozy little place! This liquid feels cool to the touch, but pleasantly so, almost like mint.
I had a small taste... It's good. Very good.
I'm half-tempted to settle down here... but, no. My exploration must continue.
I'll bottle some of this liquid for later, and leave the rest for someone else.
...Will anyone else be alive to find it?
- Robin, the scholar

I'm running out of time. The Gods do not listen to my prayers anymore. Why is this?
I ask them for more... more knowledge, more health, more time.
My body creaks and aches... I am growing too old to bear.
I don't understand. Have they given up on me?
Perhaps I have become too greedy. I am only human.
I will repent for you, my Gods...
I just need more time.
- Robin, the scholar

The small moon
The malevolent eye
The versatile, pulsing elemental stone
The Anvil calls to all of them.
You feel stronger against being frozen...
Nothing has changed. You feel as if the magic has faded.
Your mana charge speed has been passively increased!
The blasphemous art of polymorph calls to you...
You have endeared yourself to the Hunger as its host...
You suddenly realize new uses for your possessions...
You feel tempted to rely on luck just a bit more...
Malicious technology feels more natural in your hands...
You feel more ready to adapt to your surroundings...
You feel your greed overtake you for a moment...
The Hunger feigns a smile. It seems happy that you've summoned it again.
You've submitted this world to the Hunger, and leave it to move onto the next...
You are invincible briefly! Go nuts!
You are invincible briefly! Kill kill kill!
You know the drill - Go get 'em!
Use your invincibility well! Shed your worries!
You're invincible! Jump in some acid, or lava! Not polymorphine, though.
Here's some i-frames. Hope they keep you alive!
Invincibility! For you! It's yours, my friend!
Hey, you're exploring a lot! Nice job. Take some invincibility.
I'm running out of synonyms for invincible.
You are invincible briefly! ...Do you even need it at this point?
You are invincible briefly! I'm gonna start looping my dialogue.
